author: TEDx Talks
description:
What if everything we think we know about motivation is exactly backwards? In her talk, Dr. Betsy Blackard shares a new perspective on children’s responses to challenges, and offers a fresh idea for how to support them in tapping into their intrinsic motivation. You may just find that you walk away with a new perspective on your own motivation as well! 

Dr. Betsy Blackard is an expert in how kids work. She has worked closely with children for more than 20 years and has a PhD in Positive Developmental Psychology. Her research focused on the parent-child relationship, including including how parents’ beliefs and behavior impact their children. Her company, Language of Listening®, provides simple, practical tools that really work to help parents get new results for everyday challenges. 

This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: What kids know about motivation (and we don't) | Betsy Blackard | TEDxClaremontGraduateUniversity

author: TEDx Talks
description: John F. Hollway, the Associate Dean and Senior Advisor at the Quattrone Center for the Fair Administration of Justice at the University of Pennsylvania Law School, explains the benefits of Sentinel Event Reviews used in healthcare and aviation, and how they can be applied to our criminal justice system. In understanding our errors, he argues, we can work to greatly improve the safety and the quality of our criminal justice systems, bringing law enforcement and communities into deeper harmony for the protection of all. John F. Hollway is Associate Dean and Executive Director of the Quattrone Center for the Fair Administration of Justice at the University of Pennsylvania Carey Law School, and a Senior Fellow at Penn's Positive Psychology Center. His research helps organizations confront challenges and turn negative occurrences into opportunities for quality improvement. He is a national thought leader on the use of root cause analysis in criminal justice and is a frequent consultant to
title: Creating a High-Quality Criminal Justice System | John Hollway | TEDxPenn

author: TEDx Talks
description:
In the age of AI and information overload, it’s easy to forget the force that has always driven human progress — curiosity. It’s what made us ask ‘why?’ as children, and what led humanity to discover, invent, and innovate. In this talk, I emphasize that curiosity is not just a skill but one of the most essential traits that define us as human beings. I will share how we can reawaken it in daily life, since even small shifts in perspective can spark creativity, personal growth, and deeper engagement with the world around us. Graduate of Business & Technology at Lodz University of Technology and Global Business, Finance and Governance at SGH Warsaw School of Economics. Passionate about innovation, she thrives at the intersection of technology, culture, and human connection.
With a curious mind and entrepreneurial spirit, she actively participates in numerous student initiatives, academic clubs, and interdisciplinary projects. Currently, she is completing an internship focused on public
title: Reawaken curiosity in the age of AI | Karolina Juszczak | TEDxUniversity of Lodz

author: TEDx Talks
description:
• Ethnic Minority Entrepreneurs: Anchors of Community and Economy
In this powerful talk, Professor Monder Ram explores how ethnic minority entrepreneurs play a vital dual role in the UK - driving economic growth while acting as pillars of their communities. From creating jobs to offering personal support and guidance, their impact goes far beyond business. Professor Ram highlights how community organising principles have successfully engaged these business leaders, showcasing initiatives like the Business Leaders Group with Birmingham Citizens and the Time to Change report with NatWest Group.
 Professor Monder Ram OBE DL is Director of the Centre for Research in Ethnic Minority Entrepreneurship (CREME) at Aston University and one of the world’s leading authorities on ethnic minority enterprise. His pioneering research has shaped understanding and policy in the field for more than three decades.

Through CREME, Professor Ram has advanced inclusive entrepreneurship and social impact, co
title: The untold stories of ethnic minority entrepreneurs | Professor Monder Ram | TEDxAstonUniversity

author: TEDx Talks
description:
AI is often framed as magic or menace. In this talk, Dr Chris Meah demystifies it, explores what it means now and for the future, and asks a simple question: "Will AI kill us all?". It explores the courageous path for developing AI - a hopeful, grounded journey to building an AI-enabled future that makes us more human, not lesser beings. Dr Chris Meah is an AI expert, educator, and social entrepreneur, best known as the Founder and CEO of School of Code, a free national bootcamp that helps people from all backgrounds launch careers in technology. A first-class graduate in Artificial Intelligence and Computer Science, he went on to complete a PhD applying AI and computer vision to interdisciplinary research across physics, chemistry, and biomedicine.

Chris created a free online coding platform used by over 500,000 learners and founded School of Code to tackle the UK’s digital skills gap. The programme has since scaled nationally, helping thousands enter tech careers and shaping govern
title: Will AI kill us all? | Chris Meah | TEDxAstonUniversity

author: TEDx Talks
description:
The question I get asked the most is: how do you get your first client?

Over the past 3 years, I’ve helped more than 300 founders and creators build their personal brands through my agency, The Marketing Anatomy. But my journey started long before that, I’ve been writing since I was 11. And one DM changed everything.

In this talk, I share The Power of One, how a single message, one client, and one decision can completely transform your career. I break down the 3 simple steps that helped me land my first client and eventually build a personal-branding agency from scratch.

Shweta Kukreja is an entrepreneur, marketer, and founder of The Marketing Anatomy, an agency that helps entrepreneurs and creators grow their influence and build meaningful personal brands. With 5 years of experience in marketing and sixteen years of storytelling, she brings a unique blend of strategy and creativity to every brand she builds. Shweta Kukreja is a Personal Branding Strategist who helps entrepreneurs,
title: 3 steps to earn from social media | Shweta Kukreja | TEDxSVIET

author: TEDx Talks
description:
India’s greatest strength lies in its youth — but how can they rise above self-doubt and confusion to realize their true potential?

In this empowering talk, Vaibhav Tewari introduces the UVAA Model, a powerful framework that blends neuroscience and corporate insights with timeless wisdom from the Ramayana and the Bhagavad Gita.

Rooted in ancient philosophy yet designed for modern minds, this model is a form of “mental engineering” — helping individuals break free from limiting beliefs, discover purpose, and lead with clarity and conviction.

Whether you’re a student, a leader, or a dreamer, this talk will inspire you to silence inner demons and ignite meaningful change — within yourself and in the world around you.
 Vaibhav Tewari is the Co-Founder & CEO at Portea Medical. 

Portea is the largest consumer healthcare brand in India, supporting patients with world class healthcare services in the comforts of their homes. Portea has presence across 110 cities, supporting over 15000 pat
title: Breaking Barriers with UVAA | Vaibhav Tewari | TEDxYouth@JPSRanebennur

description: Celia Noreen's talk was recorded at International Full Gospel Fellowship Surabaya for TEDxSurabaya. Meet Celia Noreen, a talented 17-year-old artist weaving her experiences into poetry, songwriting, and painting. Her debut song, "Romance," written on her 14th birthday, is inspired by iconic couples from Stranger Things, Friends, and Spider-Man. Through her unique words and melodies, Celia captivates listeners with themes such as love and self-discovery. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

author: TEDx Talks
description: The world needs more artists. Utilizing artist's skills and talents in everyday life and businesses outside their traditional mediums. Revamping the 9-5 role by utilizing the skills artists have gained throughout their careers.  Originally from Vernon, BC, Amelia Sirianni spent 14 years in Toronto honing her craft as a professional musical theatre actor and has had the privilege of performing on stages across North America as well as in film and television. Amelia moved back to Vernon 9 years ago with her husband and son where she’s had the good fortune to be a part of the thriving arts community here through teaching theatre for diverse students of all ages, as well as owning and operating an early childhood music program "Itsy Bitsy Music Together" for 4 years. Amelia transitioned into the charitable non-profit sector in 2020. Working in various aspects of service delivery. In 2024, after leaving the executive director role at a local charitable society, Amelia went back to her entr
title: Reclaiming the Artist Identity  | Amelia Sirianni | TEDxKalamalka Lake

description:
The speaker sheds light on the invisible burden of migraine pain, which leads to confusion and, in some cases, disbelief. Hi, I’m Livia! I’m 17 years old and I’m Italian and Spanish. I’m currently studying 2º Bachillerato in Social Sciences, with the goal of becoming a lawyer in the future. 

I love reading and writing because they allow me to explore new ideas and express myself. 
I also enjoy listening to music, playing sports, and spending quality time with my family, which is very important to me.

In my free time, I love hanging out with my friends and trying new things, from different sports to new foods (even though I can be a bit picky when it comes to food).
 I also enjoy talking with people and spending time in nature, which helps me relax and think. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

author: TEDx Talks
description:
What happens when you walk away from everything “safe” to pursue something uncertain but true to you?

In this powerful TEDx talk, Dhairya Gangwani, a former Big 4 consultant turned career coach and LinkedIn creator, shares her deeply personal journey of leaving behind a stable corporate job to build a life of purpose, passion, and impact.

From 60+ rejections and 25 internships in college to building a thriving career in a field that barely existed 5 years ago, Dhairya reveals how *one decision*, to listen to her inner voice over the outer noise, transformed her life completely.

Key Takeaways:

Why success isn’t about climbing the ladder fast, but making sure it’s leaning against the right wall.
How to use *the method of elimination* to find clarity in your career.
The courage it takes to walk away and the freedom that comes after.
What "The Power of One" truly means: one choice, one leap, one life-changing moment.

If you’ve ever felt stuck in a career that looks good on paper but
title: Walking Away to Walk Ahead | Dhairya Gangwani | TEDxSVIET  | Dhairya Gangwani | TEDxSVIET

author: TEDx Talks
description:
An intimate reflection on how lessons from the past can shape our future legacy. Matthew recalls the moment his grandfather broke the cycle of family habits, ensuring his son could receive an education. This laid the foundation for what purposeful leadership would become for Matthew years later: creating opportunities for others. Matthew shares his view on building legacy, reflecting on the key moments in his life that shaped his purpose, and his clear vision of what leadership means.  Matthew Crummack is CEO of Domestic & General, a global appliance protection company serving nearly seven million customers across 12 countries. With over 30 years of experience leading digital, consumer, and service-oriented businesses, he is driving a major growth and transformation journey for the company.

 Earlier in his career, Matthew helped build global operations at Expedia, and began his professional journey at Procter & Gamble and Nestlé, managing brands such as Pampers, Pringles, and Nescafé
title: What do you want your legacy to be?  | Matthew Crummack | TEDxAstonUniversity

author: TEDx Talks
description:
An account of how accidentally stumbling on voluntary service led to the discovery of making voluntary service a way of life. Pam Sheemar is the Regional Acceleration Director for NatWest across the Midlands, South West and Wales, leading the entrepreneurship delivery team. 

Beyond her role at NatWest, Pam leads the longest-standing NatWest Accelerator and has mentored hundreds of founders, helping them remove barriers and unlock sustainable growth. She is deeply passionate about entrepreneurship and community empowerment, and has been instrumental in fostering innovation and inclusion through regional and national initiatives.

Pam also serves as a Magistrate and Justice of the Peace in the Black Country region, where she has served on the crime bench for over nine years. A strong advocate for community service, she leads NatWest’s support for the Midland Langar Seva Society’s homeless feeds, volunteering monthly for nearly a decade. A former Director of TechWM and Executive Directo
title: The unexpected joy of giving  | Pam Sheemar | TEDxAstonUniversity

author: TEDx Talks
description:
In this powerful and deeply personal talk, Emb Hashmi  an award-winning BBC journalist turned entrepreneur  shares how the stories we tell ourselves can limit or liberate us. Drawing on her own journey through the media and beyond, she introduces The FLIP Method: Feel it, Lift it, Inspire, Power on. A framework that helps people transform pain into purpose and setbacks into strength. Through the lens of storytelling, Emb reveals how changing your inner narrative can reshape your future, your business, and even your impact on the world. Emb Hashmi is an award-winning journalist, broadcaster, and founder of Storytelling for CEOs, the UK’s first tech-driven storytelling platform for leaders. With over 12 years of experience at the BBC, her work has featured across BBC News 24, BBC Radio 4, BBC World Service, and BBC Sport, earning her a reputation for bold, compassionate storytelling.

Her journalism has brought underrepresented voices to light—covering topics such as domestic abuse in M
title: Rethinking tomorrow: The FLIP method for transforming your story | Emb Hashmi | TEDxAstonUniversity
